ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 111 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 111 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: do intensive if you want to spend a good amount of time in the lab and get a fair amount of results
Lots of time (obviously) but I found it the most meaningful academic experience of my time at Yale.

It's probably not an option if you're looking at this review, but I would definitely recommend doing the intensive 495/496 option. With more time in the lab, you have the opportunity to have a real impact and do real research. Also--if you have the option, work with Mustafa Khokha--shameless plug but he's amazing and his whole team is wonderful
Every student has to do this. It's a great leaning experience.

Take this class if you want to get good experience with hypothesis-driven experimental biology, writing grant proposals, writing scientific-stylish paper. You have the opportunity to do real science rather than intro labs that teach you methods rather than how to think like a scientist. If you do good work then you can maybe even get published.
